department: Office of the Auditor General of Canada
appointerpost: Governor General of Canada on advice (constitutional)
termlength: 10 years during pleasure of the Governor General; mandatory retirement at age 65
salary: $334,500/year (Equal to that of a Puisne judge of the Supreme Court of Canada)
work: http://www.oag.gc.ca  The role of the '''Auditor General of Canada''' is to aid accountability by conducting independent audits of federal government operations. The Auditor General reports to the House of Commons, not to the government. These audits provide members of Parliament with objective information to help them examine the government's activities and hold it to account. __TOC__
